poem:
Title: "Escape or Destiny"

In cloaked night, a boy slips, a shadow paling.
Though young, he hears the whispered gallows tale,
Fears not the mourner's night, but dread morning's light.
In innocence, he flees the bloodhound's wail,
Within the nefarious thick, finds an unlikely veil.
A misplaced mascot, amidst iron wolves unveiled-
a poignant irony, his existence in their snare,
Survival's harsh tutor, shaping comforts in despair.
